solution.text:
We know that the diagonals of rectangle bisect each other.
So,
The coordinate of mid point of AC = coordinate of mid point of BD
i.e., (\({_{i}_+_{{i+k}}_}\over 2\) , \({_{j}_+y}\over 2\)) = (\({_{i}_+x}\over 2\) , \({_{j}_+_{{j+l}}_}\over 2\))
i.e., (\({_{{i+i+k}}_}\over 2\) , \({_{j}_+y}\over 2\)) = (\({_{i}_+x}\over 2\) , \({_{{j+l+j}}_}\over 2\))
So, \({_{i}_+x}\over 2\) = \({_{{i+i+k}}_}\over 2\) and \({_{j}_+y}\over 2\) = \({_{{j+l+j}}_}\over 2\)
So, _{i}_+x = _{{i+i+k}}_ and _{j}_+y = _{{j+l+j}}_
So, x = _{{i+k}}_ and y = _{{l+j}}_

content.text: If the points A(_{i}_,_{j}_), B(x,_{j}_), C(_{{i+k}}_,y) and D(_{i}_,_{{j+l}}_) in order forms a rectangle, find the value of x and y.
